title: A friendly reminded that elo hell exists.

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: Go ahead. Just TRY and tell me that my teams are not the ones to blame.

replies.body:
Elo hell does not exist.
All this thread does is inform people you lost a game.

Who cares if your teammates are to blame. 
You win some, you lose some.
You always make mistakes, you can always improve.
Focus on your own mistakes, and improving your own play, rather than the mistakes of randoms you'll rarely play with again.

God I am so sick of this terrible goddamn logic.

Elo hell DOES exist.
I care if my teammates are to blame because they are the ones %%%%ing up my games. You would too if you were in the same situation, I can guarantee it.
Of course you win some and lose some. That ok. That's typical. That's expected. That's FINE AND DANDY.  What is NOT fine and dandy is people who are so pathetic that they take enjoyment in actively ruining someone elses fun by being terrible. 

Yeah of course we all make mistakes. I happen to learn that %%%% as a five year old too, funnily enough. What I'm sick to death of is the mistakes of others ruining the effort I have put in. 

The part you are forgetting is that I'm only one player....and no matter how much I improve my skills I'm still not going to be able to carry a team that feeds ten %%%%ing kills in five %%%%ing minutes and loses two towers and a dragon before the fifteen minutes mark. 

Sometimes...it IS just genuinely a crap team and it's their fault. I don't know why this is so hard for people to understand.

I made no argument about why elo hell doesn't exist, so how it could it be an illogical one?

EVERYONE has lost a ranked because a team has fed.
The only thing different about you is how loudly you're crying about it.

Change your attitude.
Improve you skills.
Stop the QQ!

If you get fed and lose... that usually means you chased kills and ignored objectives.

If getting a few kills doesn't end in you also getting towers and/or dragon then those kills you got were nothing but a little gold, and in the end that's not actually worth anything if you're not using the time they're dead effectively.

> If you get fed and lose... that usually means you chased kills and ignored objectives.
> 
> If getting a few kills doesn't end in you also getting towers and/or dragon then those kills you got were nothing but a little gold, and in the end that's not actually worth anything if you're not using the time they're dead effectively.

Everything you just said implies anyone other than me was capable of killing them at all. When do you think we were "chasing kills"? Were we "chasing kills" at 3-15 ten minutes in with three turrets down?

You talk like there was any sort of botched strategy involved...when really all it was...was jax and nunu running headfirst into the enemy team and dying.

Sure man your team COULD be the reason you lost but getting heated over it does nothing so you're better off understanding that you can't do anything about the bad teams you're getting and move onto the next game hoping that they won't be as bad as the last. 

IMO the only efficient way to climb is either smash out 6k ranked games in a season with over 50% W/L or be way above the average skill level of your rank.

> Just TRY and tell me that my teams are not the ones to blame.

They are as much to blame as you are. If you think they are to blame, then you are also to blame.
Your teams are not the ones to blame.
